title: Raises the minimum and maximum tuition assistance program award an eligible graduate student may receive per semester
summary: Raises the minimum tuition assistance program award an eligible graduate student may receive per year to five hundred dollars and the maximum tuition assistance award an eligible graduate student may receive per year to eight hundred dollars.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3003

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 21, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. PERRY, MENG, BARRON -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M.
         of A. BROOK-KRASNY, COLTON, PEOPLES-STOKES, PHEFFER, TOWNS, WRIGHT  --
         read once and referred to the Committee on Higher Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to increasing the minimum
         tuition  assistance  program  award  for eligible graduate students to
         five hundred dollars per year and  increasing  the  maximum  to  eight
         hundred dollars per year

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Clause (A) of subparagraph (i) of paragraph c  of  subdivi-
    2  sion  3  of  section 667 of the education law, as added by chapter 83 of
    3  the laws of 1995, is amended to read as follows:
    4    (A) [Five] EIGHT hundred [fifty] dollars; or
    5    S 2. Subparagraph (v) of paragraph c of subdivision 3 of  section  667
    6  of  the  education  law,  as added by chapter 83 of the laws of 1995, is
    7  amended to read as follows:
    8    (v) The award shall be the net amount of the  base  amount  determined
    9  pursuant  to  subparagraph (ii) or (iii) of this paragraph but the award
   10  shall not be reduced below [seventy-five] FIVE HUNDRED dollars.  If  the
   11  income exceeds the maximum amount of income allowable under subparagraph
   12  (ii) or (iii) of this paragraph, no award shall be made.
   13    S  3.  This act shall take effect immediately, shall be deemed to have
   14  been in full force and effect on and after April 1, 2012, and  shall  be
   15  first effective for awards made for the 2012-2013 academic year.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02651-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to increasing the minimum tuition assistance program award for eligible graduate students to five hundred dollars per year and increasing the maximum to eight hundred dollars per year
